intro: Alinorchis, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Alinorchis species often have hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss. It is a perennial plant that blooms in the spring and early summer.
